title: Clean Code: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship
author: Robert C. Martin
briefing: Clean Code is a classic guide to writing maintainable, readable, and efficient code. It provides practical advice on how to improve your coding practices and produce high-quality software.

title: Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software
author: Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, John Vlissides, Grady Booch
briefing: Design Patterns is a seminal book in software engineering. It introduces 23 classic design patterns that can be used to solve common design problems when creating object-oriented software.

title: Introduction to the Theory of Computation
author: Michael Sipser
briefing: This book explores the theory of computation, formal languages, and automata. It's an essential resource for understanding the mathematical foundations of computer science.

title: Operating System Concepts
author: Abraham Silberschatz, Peter B. Galvin, Greg Gagne
briefing: Operating System Concepts is a comprehensive introduction to the principles of operating systems. It covers topics such as processes, memory management, file systems, and more.

title: Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach
author: Stuart Russell, Peter Norvig
briefing: This widely used textbook offers a comprehensive introduction to artificial intelligence. It covers topics such as problem-solving, knowledge representation, and machine learning.

title: Computer Networking: A Top-Down Approach
author: James Kurose, Keith Ross
briefing: This book provides a comprehensive introduction to computer networking. It covers topics from the application layer to the link layer, offering a top-down approach to networking.

title: Database System Concepts
author: Abraham Silberschatz, Henry F. Korth, S. Sudarshan
briefing: Database System Concepts is a comprehensive introduction to database systems. It covers topics such as relational algebra, query optimization, and transaction management.

title: Algorithms
author: Robert Sedgewick, Kevin Wayne
briefing: This book provides an in-depth introduction to algorithms. It covers fundamental concepts and techniques for designing efficient algorithms.

title: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
author: Wolfgang Ertel
briefing: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence offers a comprehensive overview of AI techniques. It covers topics such as search algorithms, knowledge representation, and machine learning.

title: Computer Organization and Design
author: David A. Patterson, John L. Hennessy
briefing: This book provides a thorough introduction to computer organization and design principles. It covers topics such as datapath and control unit design, memory hierarchy, and more.

title: Introduction to Data Mining
author: Pang-Ning Tan, Michael Steinbach, Vipin Kumar
briefing: Introduction to Data Mining offers a comprehensive introduction to data mining techniques. It covers topics such as clustering, association analysis, and anomaly detection.

title: Computer Graphics: Principles and Practice
author: John F. Hughes, Andries van Dam, Morgan McGuire, David Sklar, James D. Foley
briefing: Computer Graphics: Principles and Practice is a comprehensive guide to computer graphics. It covers topics such as rasterization, ray tracing, and 3D graphics programming.

title: Introduction to Automata Theory, Languages, and Computation
author: John E. Hopcroft, Rajeev Motwani, Jeffrey D. Ullman
briefing: Introduction to Automata Theory, Languages, and Computation is a classic text in the field of theoretical computer science. It covers formal languages, automata, and computational complexity.

title: Computer Networking: A Systems Approach
author: Larry L. Peterson, Bruce S. Davie
briefing: This book offers a systems-oriented approach to computer networking. It covers topics such as network protocols, routing, and congestion control.

title: Artificial Intelligence: Foundations of Computational Agents
author: David L. Poole, Alan K. Mackworth
briefing: Artificial Intelligence: Foundations of Computational Agents is an introductory textbook on AI. It covers topics such as logical agents, planning, and learning.

title: Introduction to the Theory of Computation
author: Michael Sipser
briefing: This book provides an introduction to the theory of computation, formal languages, and automata. It's an essential resource for computer science students.

title: Database Management Systems
author: Raghu Ramakrishnan, Johannes Gehrke
briefing: Database Management Systems is a comprehensive introduction to database systems. It covers topics such as relational algebra, query optimization, and transaction management.

title: The C Programming Language
author: Brian W. Kernighan, Dennis M. Ritchie
briefing: The C Programming Language is a classic book on the C programming language. It provides a concise and thorough introduction to the language.

title: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach
author: Stuart Russell, Peter Norvig
briefing: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence offers a comprehensive overview of AI techniques. It covers topics such as search algorithms, knowledge representation, and machine learning.

title: Computer Networking: A Top-Down Approach
author: James Kurose, Keith Ross
briefing: Computer Networking: A Top-Down Approach provides a thorough introduction to computer networking. It covers topics from the application layer to the link layer.

title: Artificial Intelligence: A Guide to Intelligent Systems
author: Michael Negnevitsky
briefing: Artificial Intelligence: A Guide to Intelligent Systems provides an accessible introduction to AI. It covers topics such as knowledge representation, reasoning, and machine learning.

title: Computer Organization and Architecture
author: William Stallings
briefing: Computer Organization and Architecture is a comprehensive introduction to computer systems and architecture. It covers topics such as instruction set architecture, memory systems, and more.

title: Introduction to Automata Theory, Languages, and Computation
author: John E. Hopcroft, Rajeev Motwani, Jeffrey D. Ullman
briefing: Introduction to Automata Theory, Languages, and Computation is a classic text in the field of theoretical computer science. It covers formal languages, automata, and computational complexity.

title: Computer Networking: Principles, Protocols and Practice
author: Olivier Bonaventure
briefing: This book offers a practical introduction to computer networking. It covers principles, protocols, and practices for building and maintaining computer networks.
